message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The fact that the anti-fungal agent used inhibits (1→3)-β-D-glucan synthase suggests that the most likely infection is Candidemia. Amphotericin B is a commonly used medication to treat Candidemia, but it has a high risk of side effects. The other options are less likely to be affected by this medication.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. An anti-fungal agent that inhibits (1→3)-β-D-glucan synthase is most effective against Candidemia, which is caused by Candida species with cell walls that contain (1→3)-β-D-glucan. Amphotericin B is also effective against Candidemia, but it has a higher side effect profile than the chosen agent. Paracoccidioidomycosis, Invasive aspergillosis, and Mucormycosis are not commonly treated with drugs that inhibit (1→3)-β-D-glucan synthase.
